name: SkinCareTipsbyVoiceFirstHealth
0:
”Alexa, what's my Flash Briefing?”
”Alexa, what's in the news?”
skdetail:
Flash Briefing Skill
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
Practical tips to help you have healthy and radiant looking skin!

Whether you, or someone you know, has been struggling with skin care, or you just need a tweak a few minor things, this flash briefing covers the top tips and tricks to help you live a confident life with healthy and vibrant looking skin! Learn more about the best approaches to skin care by tuning in daily for a skin care tip in this flash briefing by Voice First Health. 

We cover all the key topics: what is healthy skin, hydration, topical products (e.g. creams, ointments, moisturizers), lifestyle modifications (exercise, smoking cessation, and nutrition, to name just a few), common conditions (e.g. eczema, dermatitis, acne) and much more. Whether you have a few questions about your skin or a lot, this is a treasure trove of information that you can apply to your life right away so you can optimize your skin care right now. Wondering about some of those skin care myths? Chocolate? Caffeine? Greasy Food? We've got you covered as well... and that's just the beginning of what we have in store for you!

Just say, "Alexa, enable Skin Care Tips by Voice First Health" and start taking control of your skin today!

** Be sure to check out our other educational healthcare flash briefings in the Voice First Health series by searching for "Voice First Health" or visiting https://VoiceFirstHealth.com **

ABOUT US:
Skin Care Tips is hosted by Kevin Wang. Kevin is a licensed pharmacist in British Columbia, who finished his Bachelor of Science in Pharmaceutical Sciences training at UBC. Kevin has several years of experience working as a clinical pharmacist both in rural primary care and rheumatology specialty settings. He is currently a medical student at UBC with a focus on primary care and preventative health strategies.

Dr. Teri Fisher, MD, is a physician and Clinical Assistant Professor at the University of British Columbia. He is an experienced TEDx and keynote speaker, teacher, podcaster, and briefcaster with a passion for education and voice technology. He is the Founder of Voice First Health, the leading series of evidence-based educational healthcare flash briefings. He is also the founder of Briefcast.FM, the premier flash briefing network. 

ABOUT VOICE FIRST HEALTH:
Voice First Health is the industry-leading series of flash briefings at the intersection of voice technology and healthcare education. All information is evidence-based and is geared towards providing practical health care tips to improve overall health and wellness. For more information, feel free to visit https://VoiceFirstHealth.com

PLEASE NOTE:
All information provided in this flash briefing is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, treatment, or care. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider concerning any questions you may have regarding any information obtained from this flash briefing and any medical condition you believe may be relevant to you or to someone else. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay in seeking it because of something you have heard on this flash briefing. Always consult with your physician or other qualified healthcare provider before embarking on a new treatment, diet, or fitness program.
priv:
Developer Privacy Policy
The developer reported that this skill does not collect personal information.
